decks.notes: This deck focuses on using control elements like counterspells, removal, and hand disruption to slow down the opponent's game plan. It utilizes planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler to generate card advantage and maintain control of the game. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating tokens with Hero of Precinct One and gaining life with Basilica Bell-Haunt. The Elderspell and Command the Dreadhorde provide powerful finishers to close out the game once the opponent's threats have been dealt with.

The main concept of this Sultai Control deck revolves around utilizing efficient ramp and card advantage with cards like Llanowar Elves, Jadelight Ranger, Tamiyo, Collector of Tales, and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. The deck aims to control the board through removal spells like Cast Down and Assassin's Trophy while also gaining life and card advantage through Wildgrowth Walker and Hydroid Krasis. The ultimate goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and value plays, ultimately closing out the game with Command the Dreadhorde or Vraska, Golgari Queen.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thought Erasure and Despark, while also using removal spells like Tyrant's Scorn and Oath of Kaya to deal with threats on the board. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage through Teferi, Time Raveler and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, and creating token creatures with Hero of Precinct One. The deck also has a powerful finisher in Command the Dreadhorde, which allows the player to bring back key creatures from the graveyard to overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this Sultai Control deck is utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Collector of Tales and Nissa, Who Shakes the World alongside ramp creatures like Llanowar Elves and Jadelight Ranger to generate a lot of mana and card advantage. With the help of cards like Command the Dreadhorde and Hydroid Krasis, the deck aims to out value the opponent by controlling the board and overwhelming them with a wide range of threats. Assassin's Trophy and Cast Down provide removal options to handle opposing threats while also maintaining a strong board presence.

The main idea of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly play low-cost creatures and pump them up with cards like Benalish Marshal and Venerated Loxodon to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive assault. It focuses on building a wide board presence and utilizing powerful anthems to boost the team's overall strength. The deck also includes removal spells like Conclave Tribunal to deal with any problematic threats from the opponent. With a mix of efficient creatures and powerful finishers like History of Benalia, this deck aims to win the game quickly through sheer aggression.

This deck relies on powerful control cards to manipulate the board state and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats. Using cards like "Nissa, Who Shakes the World" and "Mass Manipulation" to gain control of the battlefield, while also utilizing ramp and card draw with "Growth Spiral" and "Tamiyo, Collector of Tales". With a focus on Simic colors, the deck is able to ramp into large threats like "Hydroid Krasis" and use cards like "Jadelight Ranger" to generate value. Overall, this deck aims to control the game and outvalue opponents with its powerful spells and creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils, while also creating value with cards like Basilica Bell-Haunt and Hero of Precinct One. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with removal spells like Cast Down and Despark, while also gaining incremental advantage with cards like Oath of Kaya. The deck can also pivot into a powerful late-game strategy with Command the Dreadhorde, allowing you to take advantage of your opponent's discarded creatures.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. By using cards like Thought Erasure, Despark, and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain dominance on the board. Hero of Precinct One and Basilica Bell-Haunt provide additional threats while generating value. The deck also has a toolbox aspect with cards like Mastermind's Acquisition for accessing key cards from the sideboard. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing mana ramp cards like Llanowar Elves and Incubation Druid to quickly play powerful high-cost cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis. It also includes control elements such as Teferi, Time Raveler and counter spells like Frilled Mystic to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of strong creatures and powerful spells, while also having access to ramp and control options to adapt to different matchups.

This deck focuses on quickly building a wide board of creatures through efficient token generators like Saproling Migration and Legion's Landing. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures backed up by powerful anthem effects like Flower / Flourish and The Immortal Sun. History of Benalia and Conclave Tribunal provide additional control elements while Trostani Discordant and Venerated Loxodon offer additional value and buff to the board. Tolsimir, Friend to Wolves and Emmara, Soul of the Accord provide additional synergy with the token strategy, making it difficult for opponents to keep up.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful planeswalkers. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Thought Erasure and Despark, while also generating card advantage with Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck includes a mix of board wipes like Kaya's Wrath and targeted removal such as Cast Down to deal with threats. By efficiently controlling the board and card advantage, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through attrition.

The deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers and efficient removal spells to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Narset, and Hero of Precinct One, the deck aims to establish board control and prevent the opponent from developing their own game plan. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card advantage engines, the deck can outlast aggressive strategies and grind out wins in longer games. The strategy revolves around denying the opponent resources and overwhelming them with the deck's powerful threats.

The main focus of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creature cards such as Gruul Spellbreaker, Rekindling Phoenix, and Skarrgan Hellkite. The deck is supported by ramp cards like Llanowar Elves and Paradise Druid to help play the bigger threats sooner. Nullhide Ferox provides a strong, hard-to-remove threat while Domri, Anarch of Bolas helps to boost the creatures and provide additional removal. The deck also includes some burn spells like Lightning Strike and Shock for additional reach and removal options. The mana base is optimized for a smooth curve and consistent plays.

The main idea of this Gruul Aggro deck is to establish a quick and aggressive board presence with powerful creatures like Gruul Spellbreaker, Nullhide Ferox, and Skarrgan Hellkite. Using cards like Llanowar Elves and Paradise Druid to ramp up mana, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats. Domri, Anarch of Bolas provides additional creature support and removal options, while cards like Lightning Strike offer direct damage to finish off the opponent. This deck focuses on fast, efficient aggression to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and powerful spells. By utilizing cards like Gruul Spellbreaker and Rekindling Phoenix, the strategy aims to control the board and deal damage quickly. The inclusion of cards like Domri, Anarch of Bolas and Skarrgan Hellkite further enhances the deck's aggression. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Lightning Strike and Lava Coil to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, hard-hitting creatures and efficient removal spells.

The key concept of this deck is to gain control of the game by utilizing a variety of removal spells, planeswalkers, and powerful enchantments. The deck focuses on removing threats from the opponent's side of the board while generating card advantage and incremental advantages with planeswalker abilities. By disrupting the opponent's game plan and continually generating value with planeswalker abilities, the deck aims to outpace and outvalue the opponent until it can establish a dominant board presence and close out the game.
